TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: izua za itua matjaita umaq izua za ngiaw a ita.
izoa za itoa matjaita omaq izoa za ngiaw a ita.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time in a house there was a cat.

S.FORM: qau djułam aravats azua ngiaw tua zua qiqi.
qao djoljam aravac azoa ngiaw toa zoa qiqi.
S.TRANSL: The cat was very good at catching mice.

S.FORM: manu mazepzep azua mareka ałak nua qiqi: "aku ika nakisumavan sa tja matjałałak tua kiqetsi?
mano mazepzep azoa mareka aljak noa qiqi: "ako ika nakisomavan sa tja matjaljaljak toa kiqeci?
S.TRANSL: So the mice children discussed together: “Why don’t our parents do anything about fighting the cat?

S.FORM: ku pai ari tja sikasavidan a kakeḍian sa tja qetsii azua ngiaw a namalalap tua tja sevalitan," aya, sa kaqepuqepu a mazepzep.
ko pai ari tja sikasavidan a kakedrian sa tja qecii azoa ngiaw a namalalap toa tja sevalitan," aya, sa kaqepoqepo a mazepzep.
S.TRANSL: So come on! Let us children go it alone and kill the cat that has taken our ancestors,” so they got together to discuss it.

S.FORM: ka marasudj, mapangapangał tiamadju tua uri tjałuqulu a kemats, tua tjałuuquł, sana vaivaik.
ka marasodj, mapangapangalj tiamadjo toa ori tjaljoqolo a kemac, toa tjaljooqolj, sana vaivaik.
S.TRANSL: When they had agreed, they were divided up into those who would bite the cat’s head and those who would bite its back, and off they went.

S.FORM: manu malesles tiamadju, sa senay a djemaladjalan: "makaya men aravats.
mano malesles tiamadjo, sa senay a djemaladjalan: "makaya men aravac.
S.TRANSL: So they lined up and sang as they went: “We are very strong.

S.FORM: kełu samaza-u a ngiaw; nia su papatsayaw," aya tiamadju a pasiqatsangata.
keljo samaza-o a ngiaw; nia so papacayaw," aya tiamadjo a pasiqacangata.
S.TRANSL: Come here, cat. We’re going to kill you,” they said very loudly.

S.FORM: manu langdan nazua vuluvulung a qiqi.
mano langdan nazoa volovolong a qiqi.
S.TRANSL: An old mouse heard them,

S.FORM: "semainu amen aya mun a sedjeł a kakeḍian?
"semaino amen aya mon a sedjelj a kakedrian?
S.TRANSL: and said: “Where do you think you are going, you children all on your own?

S.FORM: kemuda sa nu kakaya a qemtsi tua ngiaw?" ayain.
kemoda sa no kakaya a qemci toa ngiaw?" ayain.
S.TRANSL: How can you kill the cat?”

S.FORM: łakua, "malitseng.
ljakoa, "maliceng.
S.TRANSL: But they answered: “Be quiet.

S.FORM: pai patsutsunu amen.
pai pacocono amen.
S.TRANSL: Just watch us.

S.FORM: tjara nia qetsin," aya temvela, sa puarut sakamaya.
tjara nia qecin," aya temvela, sa poarot sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: We’ll certainly kill it,” and they just went on.

S.FORM: ka tjału qinałivan tiamadju, semkez anan a pakełang tua uri pakazuanan.
ka tjaljo qinaljivan tiamadjo, semkez anan a pakeljang toa ori pakazoanan.
S.TRANSL: When they got to the roof, they paused for instructions about the route.

S.FORM: "ari," ka ayain nazua kamakama niamadju, vaik a sema teku a mapułat a kipagału.
"ari," ka ayain nazoa kamakama niamadjo, vaik a sema teko a mapoljat a kipagaljo.
S.TRANSL: When their leader said: “Let’s go,” they all went below slowly.

S.FORM: ka manu sarigsig tiamadju, patseged azua ngiaw sa pangiaw.
ka mano sarigsig tiamadjo, paceged azoa ngiaw sa pangiaw.
S.TRANSL: But when they made a scratching noise the cat woke up and miaowed.

S.FORM: ka lemangda tiamadju, "ari," nuka ayain nua kamakama, migerger anga sakamaya a mapułat.
ka lemangda tiamadjo, "ari," noka ayain noa kamakama, migerger anga sakamaya a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: When they heard that, even though the leader said: “Come on,” they all just shook with fear.

S.FORM: ka migatsał azua ngiaw, tjara mavilavilad anga tiamadju.
ka migacalj azoa ngiaw, tjara mavilavilad anga tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: When the cat got up, they all just ran away.

S.FORM: azua zuma tjeqelas; azua zuma makelu tua qutjavan.
azoa zoma tjeqelas; azoa zoma makelo toa qotjavan.
S.TRANSL: Some slipped and some fell in their hurry.

S.FORM: ka tjału umaq anga, "pai kayaya ken," ayain anga nazua vuluvulung a qiqi, sa kapedjelian.
ka tjaljo omaq anga, "pai kayaya ken," ayain anga nazoa volovolong a qiqi, sa kapedjelian.
S.TRANSL: When they got back home, the old mouse said: “I told you so,” and laughed at them.

S.FORM: azua mareka kakeḍian a qiqi: "ku maya tja parutan a maya," ayanga tiamadju a kisan ngeli a mapułat.
azoa mareka kakedrian a qiqi: "ko maya tja parotan a maya," ayanga tiamadjo a kisan ngeli a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: And the mice children all said: “How weak we are after all,” laughing at themselves.
